overview:
Sunwoo Hwang is a strategist and entrepreneur with 17 years experience creating, incubating, and operating technology and lifestyle businesses. As Managing Director of Proof Ventures, a Silicon Valley venture firm, Sunwoo specializes in the investment and acceleration of expansion-stage Korean startups seeking growth and exit opportunities via the U.S. market.

Prior to Proof Ventures, Sunwoo ran a consumer web incubator responsible for developing use cases designed to activate music-sports fanaticism with such partners as Adobe, HP and Beats by Dr. Dre. As Co-Founder and Managing Partner of RHS Partners, a hospitality investment group, Sunwoo led the ideation and development of Vessel, a luxury boutique nightclub located in San Francisco’s Union Square district.

While Strategist and early stage EIR at venture incubator, 12 Entrepreneuring, Sunwoo co-founded and led the incubation of Northstar into an enterprise SaaS platform focused on the financial services vertical (later acquired by SEIC). Previously, Sunwoo was an operating executive at GlobalCommerce, a B2B e-commerce software company backed by G.E. Capital, where he led strategic alliances and corporate development initiatives.

Sunwoo started his career at management consultancy, A.T. Kearney, advising such clients as Samsung Electronics on international market entry strategies.

A graduate of Northwestern University, Sunwoo holds black belts in Taekwondo and Judo, and is a former U.S. national Judo champion. He’s also profiled in artist CYJO’s KYOPO Project, a global exhibition featuring 200 full-length portraits of kyopo from across the globe (presently on exhibit at the Smithsonian National Portrait Gallery in Washington D.C.)
